title: ReactExercises

metadata.description: Learn about ReactExercises with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Exercises
Test your React skills with exercises from all categories:
Get Started
ES6 Arrow Function
ES6 Variables
ES6 Array Methods
ES6 Destructuring
ES6 Spread
ES6 Ternary
JSX
Components
Props
Events
Conditionals
Lists
Hooks useState
Hooks useEffect
CSS Styling

If you haven't already,

to become a W3Schooler, and get points for every exercise you complete.
As a logged on  user you will have access to many features like having
your own web page
,
track your learning progress
,
receive personal guided paths
, and
more
.
The Exercise
We have gathered a variety of React exercises from most of the chapters in our
React Tutorial
.
The exercises are a mix of "multiple choice" and "fill in the blanks" questions. 
The answer can be found in the corresponding tutorial chapter. If you're stuck, 
or answer wrong, you can try again or hit the "Show Answer" button to see the correct answer.

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise
practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this javascript feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers ReactExercises concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ReactExercises effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ReactExercises and how to apply it in your projects.
